com.kdgregory.kdgcommons.buffer

Class BufferFacadeFactory.ByteBufferFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kdgregory.kdgcommons.buffer.BufferFacadeFactory.ByteBufferFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferFacade
    Enclosing class:
    BufferFacadeFactory

    public static class BufferFacadeFactory.ByteBufferFacade
extends Object
implements BufferFacade
    A facade for a standard Java ByteBuffer.

      Updates the single byte at the specified index (relative to the relocation base).

      Inserts the specified array into the buffer, starting at the given index (relative to the relocation base).

      Sets the 2-byte char value at the specified index (relative to the relocation base).

      Sets the 8-byte long value at the specified index (relative to the relocation base).
      void putShort(long index, short value)
      Sets the 2-byte short value at the specified index (relative to the relocation base).
      ByteBuffer slice(long index)
      Returns a ByteBuffer that represents a slice of the underlying buffer (ie, shares the same backing store), starting at the given index (relative to the relocation base) and extending to the end of the underlying buffer.

      • slice

        public ByteBuffer slice(long index)
        Description copied from interface: BufferFacade
        Returns a ByteBuffer that represents a slice of the underlying buffer (ie, shares the same backing store), starting at the given index (relative to the relocation base) and extending to the end of the underlying buffer.

        The semantics of this method depend on the underlying buffer. For a normal ByteBuffer, the limit will be determined by the size of the original buffer. For a MappedFileBuffer, the limit will depend on the particular segment containing the offset.

        Specified by:
        slice in interface BufferFacade

      • capacity

        public long capacity()
        Description copied from interface: BufferFacade
        Returns the capacity of the wrapped buffer.
        Specified by:
        capacity in interface BufferFacade

      • limit

        public long limit()
        Description copied from interface: BufferFacade
        Returns the limit of the buffer: the highest legal index + 1. Will be ≤ BufferFacade.capacity().

        Support for this method will depend on the underlying buffer's support for limits. MappedFileBuffer does not support limits, and will always return capacity. The non-threadsafe facade created by BufferFacadeFactory does support limits, but the threadsafe facade only supports limits that were set before the first facade method was invoked (because it clones the buffer).

        Specified by:
        limit in interface BufferFacade
